_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Farmers Cooperative Company at Great Plains is an Agricultural business designed and operated to serve our customers with their fertilizer needs. It strives to maintain a safe workplace.  Our farmer owners, managers, and employees have made every effort to plan for prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  One of the activities of this company is the retail sale of anhydrous ammonia to area farmers as fertilizer for crop production.

Our plant consists of one ? 12,000 gallon anhydrous ammonia tank.  The maximum quantity stored (filled at 85%) is 52,500 lbs.  In addition, there could be 15 additional anhydrous trailers, each holding 1000 gallons, that could be stored here.  This would add an additional 65,700 pounds of product ( filled at 85%).  This makes a total storage capacity of 118,200 pounds of anhydrous ammonia stored at the Great Plains Anhydrous Plant.

Our plant is operated and maintained in strict accordance with all state and federal rules and regulations.  The employees who work in the facility are training at a state school every three years and company wide on a yearly basis on the proper procedures to operate the plant, as well as the procedures to full a nurse tank.  Our workers always have fresh safety water on hand and wear the proper personal protective equipment (goggles and gloves) during ammonia operations.

Farmers Cooperative Company at Great Plains is proud to report that there have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years resulting in injury, property damage, death, evacuation, sheltering in place, or other emergency procedures.

Our emergency response plan is designed to minimize the risks to employees, the surrounding public, and area emergency responders.   Our company?s emergency response plan is shared with the local fire department and the county LEPC.
